We refer to Wikipedia articles on clinical knowledge for help. The instructor shows how to identify the right ventricle by inserting a probe into the pulmonary trunk during the dissection, as we can see in the video segment from 00:06:23 to 00:06:46.

Therefore, the answer is (A).

The correct answer is C: [00:02:21 - 00:02:56]. 

In this segment of the audio, the speaker describes how they are going to open up the right side of the heart and mentions that the tricuspid valve prevents backflow. They also point out the string-like chordae tendineae and papillary muscles, which are part of the internal features of the heart. This corresponds to the time range from 00:02:21 to 00:02:56 in the video.
